data.title: Notable Alumni
data.meta_description: From authors to Olympians, CEOs to renowned scientists, actors to presidents, and public servants to business owners, William & Mary graduates have shown success in every field.
data.text:
They were smart when they got here, but they left with something more.

From authors to Olympians, CEOs to renowned scientists, actors to presidents, and public servants to business owners, William & Mary graduates have shown success in every field. Across the board, our highly successful alumni credit their experiences at William & Mary for shaping and inspiring their future work.

We count four U.S. presidents among our alumni — so far:

Thomas Jefferson

James Monroe

John Tyler

George Washington

And while it would be impossible to list them all — though there's a long list of our notable alumni on Wikipedia — here's a sampling of impressive folks we're also proud to call our own:

Entertainment

Glenn Close '74, D.A. '89

Actress: Fatal Attraction, 101 Dalmatians

Majors: Theatre, Speech & Dance

Jon Stewart '84, D.A. '04

Comedian and television host: Host of The Daily Show, current host of The Problem with Jon Stewart

Major: Psychology

Charles "Chip" Esten '87

Actor: Outer Banks, Nashville

Major: Economics

Bill Lawrence '90

Screenwriter: Cougar Town, Ted Lasso

Major: English

Patton Oswalt '91

Comedian, Actor: Ratatouille, The King of Queens

Major: English

Cord Jefferson '04

Writer, Director: American Fiction, Watchmen

Major: Sociology

Government/Public Service

Robert Gates '65, L.H.D. '98

Former U.S. secretary of defense, W&M's 24th chancellor

Major: History

Michael Powell '85, D.P.S. '02

Former chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, member of ROTC Hall of Fame

Major: Government

Jen Psaki '00

Former White House press secretary

Major: English

Ike Irby M.P.P. '17, Ph.D. '17

Senior advisor for policy to the vice president

Major: Marine Science

Business

Joe Plumeri '66, D.P.S. '11

Top 100 Most Influential People in Finance

Major: History

Rob Estes '74

CEO and president of Estes Express Lines

Major: Business – Management

Caitlin Smallwood '88

Vice president of data science and engineering, search and assistant for Google; formerly vice president of data and insights at Netflix

Major: Mathematics

Mark Smucker '92

CEO of The J.M. Smucker Co.

Major: Geology

Stephanie Coleman Linnartz M.B.A. '97

President and CEO of Under Armour

Major: Business – Marketing

Todd Boehly '96

Co-owner and chairman of Chelsea Football Club, part owner of the Los Angeles Dodgers, chairman of MRC, which manages Billboard, Rolling Stone, and the Hollywood Reporter

Major: Business – Finance

Maybelline Mendoza '07, M.B.A. '14

Brand manager for Sprite, The Coca-Cola Co.

Majors: Business – Marketing and Hispanic Studies

Pocket Sun '13

Co-founder and managing partner, SoGal Ventures

Major: Business — Marketing, International Business concentration

Athletics

Jill Ellis '88, L.H.D. '16

Former championship-winning head coach of the U.S. Women's Soccer National Team

Major: English

Mike Tomlin '95, L.H.D. '08

Head coach of the Pittsburgh Steelers

Major: Sociology

Sean McDermott '98

Head coach of the Buffalo Bills

Major: Business — Finance

Sciences

Ellen Stofan '83, D.Sc. '16

Former director of the National Air and Space Museum, current under secretary for science and research at The Smithsonian

Major: Geology

Melissa Moore '84

Chief scientific officer emeritus for Moderna Inc.

Majors: Biology and Chemistry
